Player History
Drafted in 3rd round, 36th overall pick, by Boston in 2018...
Traded from Boston to St. Louis (B) on 3/2/2018 (Going to BOS: 2B Shuuichirou Toshitsugu. Going to SLB: RF Adam Malik)...
Injured on 5/21/2018 with a Bruised Hand, out for 4 days...
Had first career hit (double) on 6/22/2018, off Columbus Willingham (BRO)...
Hit first career homerun on 8/11/2018, off Raymond Carollo (BOS)...
Hit for the cycle against Boston on 8/11/2018...
Injured on 9/11/2018 with a Fractured Hand, out for 5 weeks...
Injured on 5/4/2019 with a Broken Finger, out for 4 weeks...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/4/2021, hitting .462 with 1 HR, 3 RBI...
Won World Series with St. Louis (B) in 2021...
1/31/2022: Gets a new one-year contract worth $1,607,143 through salary arbitration...
Was selected to the 2022 Allstar game...
Injured on 8/1/2022 with a Pulled Groin Muscle, out for 3-4 weeks...
Injured on 9/10/2022 with a Pulled Groin Muscle, out for 8 weeks...
1/31/2023: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,928,571 through salary arbitration...
1/31/2024: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,928,571 through salary arbitration...
10/20/2024: Signed a contract extension with St. Louis (B), $7,250,000 per year, for 3 years.
Won World Series with St. Louis (B) in 2025...
